content.text:
WELCOME! Thank you for agreeing to participate in our experience. 

We are interested in learning more about your experiences interacting with government agencies and representatives, or authority figures, and where you felt that an act of abuse, collusion, coercion or dishonesty occurred. We will ask you to share an experience or story around this topic, and then ask you a series of questions concerning your experience. 

There are no right or wrong answers - we are interested in hearing and understanding your experiences. The study should take about 15 to 20 min to complete.

Think of a time when you encountered or observed an act of dishonesty or collusion in your experiences with government agencies, their representatives or authority figures in the community. 

This can be a time where it facilitated or prevented a service from being properly delivered. 

This can be something that happened to you, or an experience you heard of, or witnessed.
Please describe the experience. What happened then? What decisions were made? (Scribes to take handwritten notes)

signifiers.name: Name
signifiers.title: You may also opt for a voice recording which will have to be transcribed and entered into the system as text after.

signifiers.name: Name
signifiers.title: What 3 key words would you associate with this experience?

signifiers.name: Name
signifiers.title: 1. The government agency/representative described in this story/experience is…

signifiers.name: Name
signifiers.title: 1a. If you chose "Other", please state

signifiers.name: Name
signifiers.title: 2. This experience made me feel… (Choose up to 2)

signifiers.name: Name
signifiers.title: 2a. If you chose "Other", please specify

content.text:
We will now be asking you some questions about the experience you shared. Please drag the ball in each triangle to a position that best describes your experience. The closer the ball to any one corner, the stronger that description is in relation to your experience. However by placing the ball in the centre means you agree equally with all three.  If a triangle topic does not relate to your experience, check the N/A box.

You may utilise the sample triad at the beginning to test.

signifiers.name: Name
signifiers.title: Sample. Think about the last stew you had. How would you describe the balance of ingredients?

content.text: Now, let's go back to your experience…

signifiers.name: Name
signifiers.title: 3.  In this experience, the behaviour was wrong because it went against…

labels.text: what is good for the majority

signifiers.name: Name
signifiers.title: 4. In this experience, those in authority...

labels.text: acted in collusion with other people

signifiers.name: Name
signifiers.title: 5. In this experience, what was most important to me was...

labels.text: how it demonstrated if we can trust the government
whether people played by the rules

signifiers.name: Name
signifiers.title: 6. In this experience, the actions of those in authority were influenced by their sense of…

signifiers.name: Name
signifiers.title: 7. In this experience, those in authority were acting in the interest of…

signifiers.name: Name
signifiers.title: 8. This experience shows an attitude where people seek to...

signifiers.name: Name
signifiers.title: 9. Based on this experience, the responsibility for doing the right thing belongs to...

signifiers.name: Name
signifiers.title: 10. Based on this experience, misconduct among people in authority could be better managed/prevented through…

content.text:
We will now be asking you some questions about the experience you shared on slider questions. Please drag the ball on each scale to a position that best describes your experience. The closer the ball to any one side, the stronger that description is in relation to your experience. However by placing the ball in the centre means you agree equally with both sides.  If a slider topic does not relate to your experience, check the N/A box.

You may utilise the sample slider below to test.

signifiers.name: Name
signifiers.title: Sample. Thinking about the stew you described earlier, what was the temperature of the stew?

content.text: Now, let's go back to the experience you described…

content.text: Please save your entry by clicking the SAVE button below. Please wait for confirmation before you close your browser. This may take a few moments. If the button is greyed out, you may have missed a question. Thank you!
